creator: drmoose@drmoose.dyndns.org
text:
My VirtualHost configuration was almost exactly what was listed in the
documentation at http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/vhosts/name-based.html, but I
still had to spend literally days trying to make this error go away:

VirtualHost *:80 -- mixing * ports and non-* ports with a NameVirtualHost
address is not supported, proceeding with undefined results

Googling revealed many mailing lists where people had asked questions about this
error but gotten vague or incorrect replies.

It would have been very helpful if there were a note in the docs like this:

"If you get an error about mixing * ports and non-* ports when trying to
configure NameVirtualHosts, or that your NameVirtualHost has no VirtualHosts,
check to make sure that a different VirtualHost configuration has not already
been defined in one of the files included from apache2.conf"

Thanks!

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #0)

> "If you get an error about mixing * ports and non-* ports when trying to
> configure NameVirtualHosts, or that your NameVirtualHost has no VirtualHosts,
> check to make sure that a different VirtualHost configuration has not already
> been defined in one of the files included from apache2.conf"

What I'd really like to see is a document that lists all the error messages, and
has an explanation of exactly what is meant by the error message, and what to do
to fix the problem.

Regarding this particular problem, yes, I agree more documentation is needed.

creator: tony@pc-tony.com
text:
This error has been documented in the HTTPD wiki pages.  You can see it here
http://wiki.apache.org/httpd/VirtualHostsMixingPorts

Cheers,
Tony
